intro: Hieracium atratum, commonly known as the black hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its flowers are dark purple to black in color, with yellow central disks, and it produces numerous small, oval-shaped seeds. Hieracium atratum is often considered a weed due to its rapid spread and ability to thrive in various conditions.
